summary: Validates a SAM or BAM file.

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and GELI).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: List of validation error types to ignore.
arguments.name: --IGNORE

arguments.summary: If true, only report errors and ignore warnings.
arguments.name: --IGNORE_WARNINGS

arguments.summary: If set to anything other than IndexValidationStringency.NONE and input is a BAM file with an index file, also validates the index at the specified stringency. Until VALIDATE_INDEX is retired, VALIDATE INDEX and INDEX_VALIDATION_STRINGENCY must agree on whether to validate the index.
arguments.name: --INDEX_VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Input SAM/BAM file
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: Whether the SAM or BAM file consists of bisulfite sequenced reads. If so, C->T is not counted as an error in computing the value of the NM tag.
arguments.name: --IS_BISULFITE_SEQUENCED

arguments.summary: Relevant for a coordinate-sorted file containing read pairs only. Maximum number of file handles to keep open when spilling mate info to disk. Set this number a little lower than the per-process maximum number of file that may be open. This number can be found by executing the 'ulimit -n' command on a Unix system.
arguments.name: --MAX_OPEN_TEMP_FILES

arguments.summary: The maximum number of lines output in verbose mode
arguments.name: --MAX_OUTPUT

arguments.summary: When writing SAM files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort a SAM file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Mode of output
arguments.name: --MODE

arguments.summary: Output file or standard out if missing
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: If true, this tool will not attempt to validate mate information. In general cases, this option should not be used.  However, in cases where samples have very high duplication or chimerism rates (> 10%), the mate validation process often requires extremely large amounts of memory to run, so this flag allows you to forego that check.
arguments.name: --SKIP_MATE_VALIDATION

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: DEPRECATED.  Use INDEX_VALIDATION_STRINGENCY instead.  If true and input is a BAM file with an index file, also validates the index.  Until this parameter is retired VALIDATE INDEX and INDEX_VALIDATION_STRINGENCY must agree on whether to validate the index.
arguments.name: --VALIDATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

name: ValidateSamFile
